newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber closes down on poor sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber closes down on poor sentiment.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended down after the market closed the day with virtually no trades reported, said dealers.
There were no sales or inquiries, the dealers said, adding that the closure of the Bangkok and Tokyo markets led to further uncertainties in pricing.
"Nothing happened today," said an official trade source. "Maybe, we'll see something tomorrow."
The Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted June RSS One buyer at 275.50 cents ($1.10) a kg, down half cent from Friday. June SMR20 buyer was also half cent lower at 259.
Trading houses offered the SMR CV at 332 cents, SMR L at 310 cents, SMR 5 at 269, SMR 10 at 255 and drum latex at 228 cents.
Dealers said prices were expected to fall further with the steady supply of latex after recent improvements in the weather.

The INRO five-day moving indicator was quoted at 208.05 Malaysian/Singaporean cents per kg on May 2, compared to the 208.10 on April 30. The daily indicator was, however, higher at 208.57 from 207.43 previously.
